description: Describes the specified Firehose stream and its status. For example, after your Firehose stream is created, call DescribeDeliveryStream to see whether the Firehose stream is ACTIVE and therefore ready for data to be sent to it. If the status of a Firehose stream is CREATING_FAILED, this status doesn't change, and you can't invoke  CreateDeliveryStream again on it. However, you can invoke the  DeleteDeliveryStream operation to delete it. If the status is DELETING_FAILED, you can force deletion by invoking  DeleteDeliveryStream again but with  DeleteDeliveryStreamInput$AllowForceDelete set to true.

parameters.name: DeliveryStreamName
parameters.description: The name of the Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStreamDescription
nested_items.description: Information about the Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStreamARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Firehose stream. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStreamStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the Firehose stream. If the status of a Firehose stream is CREATING_FAILED, this status doesn't change, and you can't invoke CreateDeliveryStream again on it. However, you can invoke the  DeleteDeliveryStream operation to delete it.

nested_items.name: FailureDescription
nested_items.description: Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to an error related to KMS:  CreateDeliveryStream,  DeleteDeliveryStream,  StartDeliveryStreamEncryption,  StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of error that caused the failure.

nested_items.name: Details
nested_items.description: A message providing details about the error that caused the failure.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Indicates the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: KeyARN
nested_items.description: If KeyType is CUSTOMER_MANAGED_CMK, this field contains the ARN of the customer managed CMK. If KeyType is Amazon Web Services_OWNED_CMK, DeliveryStreamEncryptionConfiguration doesn't contain a value for KeyARN.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: Indicates the type of customer master key (CMK) that is used for encryption. The default setting is Amazon Web Services_OWNED_CMK. For more information about CMKs, see Customer Master Keys (CMKs).

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: This is the server-side encryption (SSE) status for the Firehose stream. For a full description of the different values of this status, see  StartDeliveryStreamEncryption and  StopDeliveryStreamEncryption. If this status is ENABLING_FAILED or DISABLING_FAILED, it is the status of the most recent attempt to enable or disable SSE, respectively.

nested_items.name: FailureDescription
nested_items.description: Provides details in case one of the following operations fails due to an error related to KMS:  CreateDeliveryStream,  DeleteDeliveryStream,  StartDeliveryStreamEncryption,  StopDeliveryStreamEncryption.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of error that caused the failure.

nested_items.name: Details
nested_items.description: A message providing details about the error that caused the failure.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStreamType
nested_items.description: The Firehose stream type. This can be one of the following values:
DirectPut: Provider applications access the Firehose stream directly.
KinesisStreamAsSource: The Firehose stream uses a Kinesis data stream as a source.

nested_items.name: VersionId
nested_items.description: Each time the destination is updated for a Firehose stream, the version ID is changed, and the current version ID is required when updating the destination. This is so that the service knows it is applying the changes to the correct version of the delivery stream.

nested_items.name: CreateTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time that the Firehose stream was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date and time that the Firehose stream was last updated.

nested_items.name: DirectPutSourceDescription
nested_items.description: Details about Direct PUT used as the source for a Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: ThroughputHintInMBs
nested_items.description: The value that you configure for this parameter is for information purpose only and does not affect Firehose delivery throughput limit. You can use the Firehose Limits form to request a throughput limit increase.

nested_items.name: KinesisStreamSourceDescription
nested_items.description: The  KinesisStreamSourceDescription value for the source Kinesis data stream.

nested_items.name: KinesisStreamARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see Amazon Kinesis Data Streams ARN Format.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role used by the source Kinesis data stream. For more information, see Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) ARN Format.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStartTimestamp
nested_items.description: Firehose starts retrieving records from the Kinesis data stream starting with this timestamp.

nested_items.name: MSKSourceDescription
nested_items.description: The configuration description for the Amazon MSK cluster to be used as the source for a delivery stream.

nested_items.name: MSKClusterARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon MSK cluster.

nested_items.name: TopicName
nested_items.description: The topic name within the Amazon MSK cluster.

nested_items.name: AuthenticationConfiguration
nested_items.description: The authentication configuration of the Amazon MSK cluster.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role used to access the Amazon MSK cluster.

nested_items.name: Connectivity
nested_items.description: The type of connectivity used to access the Amazon MSK cluster.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStartTimestamp
nested_items.description: Firehose starts retrieving records from the topic within the Amazon MSK cluster starting with this timestamp.

nested_items.name: ReadFromTimestamp
nested_items.description: The start date and time in UTC for the offset position within your MSK topic from where Firehose begins to read. By default, this is set to timestamp when Firehose becomes Active.

nested_items.name: DatabaseSourceDescription
nested_items.description: Details about a database used as the source for a Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of database engine. This can be one of the following values.
MySQL.
PostgreSQL.

nested_items.name: Endpoint
nested_items.description: The endpoint of the database server.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port of the database. This can be one of the following values.
3306 for MySQL database type.
5432 for PostgreSQL database type.

nested_items.name: SSLMode
nested_items.description: The mode to enable or disable SSL when Firehose connects to the database endpoint.

nested_items.name: Databases
nested_items.description: The list of database patterns in source database endpoint for Firehose to read from.

nested_items.description: The list of database patterns in source database endpoint to be included for Firehose to read from.

nested_items.description: The fully qualified name of the table in source database endpoint that Firehose uses to track snapshot progress.

nested_items.name: SnapshotInfo
nested_items.description: The structure that describes the snapshot information of a table in source database endpoint that Firehose reads.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the current snapshot of the table in source database endpoint.

nested_items.name: Table
nested_items.description: The fully qualified name of the table in source database endpoint that Firehose reads.

nested_items.name: RequestTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp when the current snapshot is taken on the table.

nested_items.name: RequestedBy
nested_items.description: The principal that sent the request to take the current snapshot on the table.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the current snapshot of the table.

nested_items.name: DatabaseSourceAuthenticationConfiguration
nested_items.description: The structure to configure the authentication methods for Firehose to connect to source database endpoint.

nested_items.name: SecretsManagerConfiguration
nested_items.description: The structure that defines how Firehose accesses the secret.

nested_items.name: SecretARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the secret that stores your credentials. It must be in the same region as the Firehose stream and the role. The secret ARN can reside in a different account than the Firehose stream and role as Firehose supports cross-account secret access. This parameter is required when Enabled is set to True.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: Specifies the role that Firehose assumes when calling the Secrets Manager API operation. When you provide the role, it overrides any destination specific role defined in the destination configuration. If you do not provide the then we use the destination specific role. This parameter is required for Splunk.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether you want to use the secrets manager feature. When set as True the secrets manager configuration overwrites the existing secrets in the destination configuration. When it's set to False Firehose falls back to the credentials in the destination configuration.

nested_items.name: DatabaseSourceVPCConfiguration
nested_items.description: The details of the VPC Endpoint Service which Firehose uses to create a PrivateLink to the database.

nested_items.name: VpcEndpointServiceName
nested_items.description: The VPC endpoint service name which Firehose uses to create a PrivateLink to the database. The endpoint service must have the Firehose service principle firehose.amazonaws.com as an allowed principal on the VPC endpoint service. The VPC endpoint service name is a string that looks like com.amazonaws.vpce.<region>.<vpc-endpoint-service-id>.

nested_items.description: The ID of the destination.

nested_items.description: [Deprecated] The destination in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: The 'YYYY/MM/DD/HH' time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

nested_items.name: ErrorOutputPrefix
nested_items.description: A prefix that Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

nested_items.name: BufferingHints
nested_items.description: The buffering option. If no value is specified, BufferingHints object default values are used.

nested_items.name: SizeInMBs
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for IntervalInSeconds, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: IntervalInSeconds
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for SizeInMBs, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: CompressionFormat
nested_items.description: The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is UNCOMPRESSED.

nested_items.name: EncryptionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no encryption.

nested_items.name: NoEncryptionConfig
nested_items.description: Specifically override existing encryption information to ensure that no encryption is used.

nested_items.name: KMSEncryptionConfig
nested_items.description: The encryption key.

nested_items.name: AWSKMSKeyARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to the same Amazon Web Services Region as the destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.name: DataFormatConversionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The serializer, deserializer, and schema for converting data from the JSON format to the Parquet or ORC format before writing it to Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: SchemaConfiguration
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services Glue Data Catalog table that contains the column information. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The role that Firehose can use to access Amazon Web Services Glue. This role must be in the same account you use for Firehose. Cross-account roles aren't allowed.

nested_items.name: CatalogId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Glue Data Catalog. If you don't supply this, the Amazon Web Services account ID is used by default.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon Web Services Glue database that contains the schema for the output data.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services Glue table that contains the column information that constitutes your data schema.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: If you don't specify an Amazon Web Services Region, the default is the current Region.

nested_items.name: VersionId
nested_items.description: Specifies the table version for the output data schema. If you don't specify this version ID, or if you set it to LATEST, Firehose uses the most recent version. This means that any updates to the table are automatically picked up.

nested_items.name: InputFormatConfiguration
nested_items.description: Specifies the deserializer that you want Firehose to use to convert the format of your data from JSON. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

nested_items.name: Deserializer
nested_items.description: Specifies which deserializer to use. You can choose either the Apache Hive JSON SerDe or the OpenX JSON SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the request.

nested_items.name: OpenXJsonSerDe
nested_items.description: The OpenX SerDe. Used by Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is the native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe.

nested_items.name: ConvertDotsInJsonKeysToUnderscores
nested_items.description: When set to true, specifies that the names of the keys include dots and that you want Firehose to replace them with underscores. This is useful because Apache Hive does not allow dots in column names. For example, if the JSON contains a key whose name is 'a.b', you can define the column name to be 'a_b' when using this option.

nested_items.name: CaseInsensitive
nested_items.description: When set to true, which is the default, Firehose converts JSON keys to lowercase before deserializing them.

nested_items.name: ColumnToJsonKeyMappings
nested_items.description: Maps column names to JSON keys that aren't identical to the column names. This is useful when the JSON contains keys that are Hive keywords. For example, timestamp is a Hive keyword. If you have a JSON key named timestamp, set this parameter to {"ts": "timestamp"} to map this key to a column named ts.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: HiveJsonSerDe
nested_items.description: The native Hive / HCatalog JsonSerDe. Used by Firehose for deserializing data, which means converting it from the JSON format in preparation for serializing it to the Parquet or ORC format. This is one of two deserializers you can choose, depending on which one offers the functionality you need. The other option is the OpenX SerDe.

nested_items.name: TimestampFormats
nested_items.description: Indicates how you want Firehose to parse the date and timestamps that may be present in your input data JSON. To specify these format strings, follow the pattern syntax of JodaTime's DateTimeFormat format strings. For more information, see Class DateTimeFormat. You can also use the special value millis to parse timestamps in epoch milliseconds. If you don't specify a format, Firehose uses java.sql.Timestamp::valueOf by default.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: OutputFormatConfiguration
nested_items.description: Specifies the serializer that you want Firehose to use to convert the format of your data to the Parquet or ORC format. This parameter is required if Enabled is set to true.

nested_items.name: Serializer
nested_items.description: Specifies which serializer to use. You can choose either the ORC SerDe or the Parquet SerDe. If both are non-null, the server rejects the request.

nested_items.name: ParquetSerDe
nested_items.description: A serializer to use for converting data to the Parquet format before storing it in Amazon S3. For more information, see Apache Parquet.

nested_items.name: BlockSizeBytes
nested_items.description: The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.

nested_items.name: PageSizeBytes
nested_items.description: The Parquet page size. Column chunks are divided into pages. A page is conceptually an indivisible unit (in terms of compression and encoding). The minimum value is 64 KiB and the default is 1 MiB.

nested_items.name: Compression
nested_items.description: The compression code to use over data blocks. The possible values are UNCOMPRESSED, SNAPPY, and GZIP, with the default being SNAPPY. Use SNAPPY for higher decompression speed. Use GZIP if the compression ratio is more important than speed.

nested_items.name: EnableDictionaryCompression
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to enable dictionary compression.

nested_items.name: MaxPaddingBytes
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of padding to apply. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 0.

nested_items.name: WriterVersion
nested_items.description: Indicates the version of row format to output. The possible values are V1 and V2. The default is V1.

nested_items.name: StripeSizeBytes
nested_items.description: The number of bytes in each stripe. The default is 64 MiB and the minimum is 8 MiB.

nested_items.name: BlockSizeBytes
nested_items.description: The Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) block size. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is 256 MiB and the minimum is 64 MiB. Firehose uses this value for padding calculations.

nested_items.name: RowIndexStride
nested_items.description: The number of rows between index entries. The default is 10,000 and the minimum is 1,000.

nested_items.name: EnablePadding
nested_items.description: Set this to true to indicate that you want stripes to be padded to the HDFS block boundaries. This is useful if you intend to copy the data from Amazon S3 to HDFS before querying. The default is false.

nested_items.name: PaddingTolerance
nested_items.description: A number between 0 and 1 that defines the tolerance for block padding as a decimal fraction of stripe size. The default value is 0.05, which means 5 percent of stripe size.

nested_items.name: Compression
nested_items.description: The compression code to use over data blocks. The default is SNAPPY.

nested_items.name: BloomFilterColumns
nested_items.description: The column names for which you want Firehose to create bloom filters. The default is null.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BloomFilterFalsePositiveProbability
nested_items.description: The Bloom filter false positive probability (FPP). The lower the FPP, the bigger the Bloom filter. The default value is 0.05, the minimum is 0, and the maximum is 1.

nested_items.name: DictionaryKeyThreshold
nested_items.description: Represents the fraction of the total number of non-null rows. To turn off dictionary encoding, set this fraction to a number that is less than the number of distinct keys in a dictionary. To always use dictionary encoding, set this threshold to 1.

nested_items.name: FormatVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the file to write. The possible values are V0_11 and V0_12. The default is V0_12.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Defaults to true. Set it to false if you want to disable format conversion while preserving the configuration details.

nested_items.name: DynamicPartitioningConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of the dynamic partitioning mechanism that creates smaller data sets from the streaming data by partitioning it based on partition keys. Currently, dynamic partitioning is only supported for Amazon S3 destinations.

nested_items.name: RetryOptions
nested_items.description: The retry behavior in case Firehose is unable to deliver data to an Amazon S3 prefix.

nested_items.name: DurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: The period of time during which Firehose retries to deliver data to the specified destination.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies that the dynamic partitioning is enabled for this Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: FileExtension
nested_items.description: Specify a file extension. It will override the default file extension.

nested_items.name: CustomTimeZone
nested_items.description: The time zone you prefer. UTC is the default.

nested_items.name: RedshiftDestinationDescription
nested_items.description: The destination in Amazon Redshift.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.description: The name of the target table. The table must already exist in the database.

nested_items.name: DataTableColumns
nested_items.description: A comma-separated list of column names.

nested_items.name: CopyOptions
nested_items.description: Optional parameters to use with the Amazon Redshift COPY command. For more information, see the 'Optional Parameters' section of Amazon Redshift COPY command. Some possible examples that would apply to Firehose are as follows:

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: The name of the user.

nested_items.name: RetryOptions
nested_items.description: The retry behavior in case Firehose is unable to deliver documents to Amazon Redshift. Default value is 3600 (60 minutes).

nested_items.name: DurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: The length of time during which Firehose retries delivery after a failure, starting from the initial request and including the first attempt. The default value is 3600 seconds (60 minutes). Firehose does not retry if the value of DurationInSeconds is 0 (zero) or if the first delivery attempt takes longer than the current value.

nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 destination.

nested_items.name: BucketARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: The 'YYYY/MM/DD/HH' time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

nested_items.name: ErrorOutputPrefix
nested_items.description: A prefix that Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

nested_items.name: BufferingHints
nested_items.description: The buffering option. If no value is specified, BufferingHints object default values are used.

nested_items.name: SizeInMBs
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for IntervalInSeconds, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: IntervalInSeconds
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for SizeInMBs, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: CompressionFormat
nested_items.description: The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is UNCOMPRESSED.

nested_items.name: EncryptionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no encryption.

nested_items.name: NoEncryptionConfig
nested_items.description: Specifically override existing encryption information to ensure that no encryption is used.

nested_items.name: KMSEncryptionConfig
nested_items.description: The encryption key.

nested_items.name: AWSKMSKeyARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to the same Amazon Web Services Region as the destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.description: The ARN of the secret that stores your credentials. It must be in the same region as the Firehose stream and the role. nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: Specifies the role that Firehose assumes when calling the Secrets Manager API operation. When you provide the role, it overrides any destination specific role defined in the destination configuration. If you do not provide the then we use the destination specific role. This parameter is required for Splunk.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether you want to use the secrets manager feature. When set as True the secrets manager configuration overwrites the existing secrets in the destination configuration. When it's set to False Firehose falls back to the credentials in the destination configuration.

nested_items.description: The details of the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch or the Amazon OpenSearch Serverless destination.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: The IDs of the subnets that Firehose uses to create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch Service destination. Make sure that the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that have the destination Amazon OpenSearch Service endpoints. Firehose creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that the Firehose stream uses to create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In either case, make sure that the role trusts the Firehose service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
ec2:DescribeVpcs.
ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute.
ec2:DescribeSubnets.
ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups.
ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces.
ec2:CreateNetworkInterface.
ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission.
ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The IDs of the security groups that Firehose uses when it creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch Service destination. You can use the same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones. If you specify different security groups, ensure that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's security group. Also ensure that the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you use the same security group for both your Firehose stream and the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see Security group rules in the Amazon VPC documentation.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DefaultDocumentIdFormat
nested_items.description: When the FIREHOSE_DEFAULT option is chosen, Firehose generates a unique document ID for each record based on a unique internal identifier. The generated document ID is stable across multiple delivery attempts, which helps prevent the same record from being indexed multiple times with different document IDs.

nested_items.description: The destination in Splunk.

nested_items.name: HECEndpoint
nested_items.description: The HTTP Event Collector (HEC) endpoint to which Firehose sends your data.

nested_items.name: HECEndpointType
nested_items.description: This type can be either 'Raw' or 'Event.'

nested_items.name: HECToken
nested_items.description: A GUID you obtain from your Splunk cluster when you create a new HEC endpoint.

nested_items.name: HECAcknowledgmentTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: The amount of time that Firehose waits to receive an acknowledgment from Splunk after it sends it data. At the end of the timeout period, Firehose either tries to send the data again or considers it an error, based on your retry settings.

nested_items.name: RetryOptions
nested_items.description: The retry behavior in case Firehose is unable to deliver data to Splunk or if it doesn't receive an acknowledgment of receipt from Splunk.

nested_items.name: DurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: The total amount of time that Firehose spends on retries. This duration starts after the initial attempt to send data to Splunk fails. It doesn't include the periods during which Firehose waits for acknowledgment from Splunk after each attempt.

nested_items.name: S3BackupMode
nested_items.description: Defines how documents should be delivered to Amazon S3. When set to FailedDocumentsOnly, Firehose writes any data that could not be indexed to the configured Amazon S3 destination. When set to AllDocuments, Firehose delivers all incoming records to Amazon S3, and also writes failed documents to Amazon S3. Default value is FailedDocumentsOnly.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: The IDs of the subnets that Firehose uses to create ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch Service destination. Make sure that the routing tables and inbound and outbound rules allow traffic to flow from the subnets whose IDs are specified here to the subnets that have the destination Amazon OpenSearch Service endpoints. Firehose creates at least one ENI in each of the subnets that are specified here. Do not delete or modify these ENIs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that the Firehose stream uses to create endpoints in the destination VPC. You can use your existing Firehose delivery role or you can specify a new role. In either case, make sure that the role trusts the Firehose service principal and that it grants the following permissions:
ec2:DescribeVpcs.
ec2:DescribeVpcAttribute.
ec2:DescribeSubnets.
ec2:DescribeSecurityGroups.
ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces.
ec2:CreateNetworkInterface.
ec2:CreateNetworkInterfacePermission.
ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The IDs of the security groups that Firehose uses when it creates ENIs in the VPC of the Amazon OpenSearch Service destination. You can use the same security group that the Amazon ES domain uses or different ones. If you specify different security groups, ensure that they allow outbound HTTPS traffic to the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's security group. Also ensure that the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain's security group allows HTTPS traffic from the security groups specified here. If you use the same security group for both your Firehose stream and the Amazon OpenSearch Service domain, make sure the security group inbound rule allows HTTPS traffic. For more information about security group rules, see Security group rules in the Amazon VPC documentation.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: The column name to be configured in partition spec.

nested_items.name: S3ErrorOutputPrefix
nested_items.description: The table specific S3 error output prefix. All the errors that occurred while delivering to this table will be prefixed with this value in S3 destination.

nested_items.name: SchemaEvolutionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The description of automatic schema evolution configuration.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specify whether you want to enable schema evolution.

nested_items.name: TableCreationConfiguration
nested_items.description: The description of table creation configuration.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specify whether you want to enable automatic table creation.

nested_items.name: BufferingHints
nested_items.description: Describes hints for the buffering to perform before delivering data to the destination. These options are treated as hints, and therefore Firehose might choose to use different values when it is optimal. The SizeInMBs and IntervalInSeconds parameters are optional. However, if specify a value for one of them, you must also provide a value for the other.

nested_items.name: SizeInMBs
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for IntervalInSeconds, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: IntervalInSeconds
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for SizeInMBs, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLoggingOptions
nested_items.description: Describes the Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Enables or disables CloudWatch logging.

nested_items.name: LogGroupName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch group name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging is enabled.

nested_items.name: LogStreamName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch log stream name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging is enabled.

nested_items.name: ProcessingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Describes a data processing configuration.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Enables or disables data processing.

nested_items.name: Processors
nested_items.description: The data processors.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of processor.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: The processor parameters.

nested_items.name: ParameterName
nested_items.description: The name of the parameter. Currently the following default values are supported: 3 for NumberOfRetries and 60 for the BufferIntervalInSeconds. The BufferSizeInMBs ranges between 0.2 MB and up to 3MB. The default buffering hint is 1MB for all destinations, except Splunk. For Splunk, the default buffering hint is 256 KB.

nested_items.name: ParameterValue
nested_items.description: The parameter value.

nested_items.name: S3BackupMode
nested_items.description: Describes how Firehose will backup records. Currently,Firehose only supports FailedDataOnly.

nested_items.name: RetryOptions
nested_items.description: The retry behavior in case Firehose is unable to deliver data to a destination.

nested_items.name: DurationInSeconds
nested_items.description: The period of time during which Firehose retries to deliver data to the specified destination.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to be assumed by Firehose for calling Apache Iceberg Tables.

nested_items.name: AppendOnly
nested_items.description: Describes whether all incoming data for this delivery stream will be append only (inserts only and not for updates and deletes) for Iceberg delivery. This feature is only applicable for Apache Iceberg Tables.

nested_items.name: CatalogConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration describing where the destination Iceberg tables are persisted.

nested_items.name: CatalogARN
nested_items.description: Specifies the Glue catalog ARN identifier of the destination Apache Iceberg Tables. You must specify the ARN in the format arn:aws:glue:region:account-id:catalog.

nested_items.name: WarehouseLocation
nested_items.description: The warehouse location for Apache Iceberg tables. You must configure this when schema evolution and table creation is enabled.

nested_items.name: S3DestinationDescription
nested_items.description: Describes a destination in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Web Services credentials. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.name: BucketARN
nested_items.description: The ARN of the S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.name: Prefix
nested_items.description: The 'YYYY/MM/DD/HH' time format prefix is automatically used for delivered Amazon S3 files. You can also specify a custom prefix, as described in Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

nested_items.name: ErrorOutputPrefix
nested_items.description: A prefix that Firehose evaluates and adds to failed records before writing them to S3. This prefix appears immediately following the bucket name. For information about how to specify this prefix, see Custom Prefixes for Amazon S3 Objects.

nested_items.name: BufferingHints
nested_items.description: The buffering option. If no value is specified, BufferingHints object default values are used.

nested_items.name: SizeInMBs
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data to the specified size, in MiBs, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 5. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for IntervalInSeconds, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: IntervalInSeconds
nested_items.description: Buffer incoming data for the specified period of time, in seconds, before delivering it to the destination. The default value is 300. This parameter is optional but if you specify a value for it, you must also specify a value for SizeInMBs, and vice versa.

nested_items.name: CompressionFormat
nested_items.description: The compression format. If no value is specified, the default is UNCOMPRESSED.

nested_items.name: EncryptionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The encryption configuration. If no value is specified, the default is no encryption.

nested_items.name: NoEncryptionConfig
nested_items.description: Specifically override existing encryption information to ensure that no encryption is used.

nested_items.name: KMSEncryptionConfig
nested_items.description: The encryption key.

nested_items.name: AWSKMSKeyARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the encryption key. Must belong to the same Amazon Web Services Region as the destination Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, see Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) and Amazon Web Services Service Namespaces.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLoggingOptions
nested_items.description: The Amazon CloudWatch logging options for your Firehose stream.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Enables or disables CloudWatch logging.

nested_items.name: LogGroupName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch group name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging is enabled.

nested_items.name: LogStreamName
nested_items.description: The CloudWatch log stream name for logging. This value is required if CloudWatch logging is enabled.

nested_items.name: HasMoreDestinations
nested_items.description: Indicates whether there are more destinations available to list.
